In negotiations like this, no deal is perfect. But shutting down the government should be a last resort. I'm grateful to colleagues on both sides of the aisle for joining me to get this bill over the finish line.

I'm encouraged to see Democrats join House Republicans to pass a clean, short-term spending bill to keep the government open and avoid a shutdown. To me, this is not a red issue or a blue issue. This is a red, white, and blue issue.
You have to put the money in before you can write the check to take the money out. It's a concept some children -- and some in Washington -- do not understand.

When it comes to the federal budget, you have to break things down into Kitchen Table Economics. So here's the truth: if a family managed their budget like the federal budget, they would rack up $19,000 in debt this year. Except this is in trillions.

It's important to know exactly what budget Congress is -- and is not -- debating this week. Take a look at these graphics, the numbers tell the story. I took to the House floor this afternoon to explain what it means for the hardworking American taxpayer.

As Chairman of the @WaysandMeansGOP Tax Subcommittee, I will always make sure America is a leader in the global economy. The hearing I chaired today highlighted just how OECD, supported by the Biden administration, is a bad deal for American taxpayers, workers, and businesses.

OECD is a bad deal for the American taxpayers, American workers, and American businesses just trying to keep their doors open for the next generation U.S. workers. Congress must have a seat at the table on this matter.

60% of the revenue divided up under the Pillar 1 agreement would come from US firms.  60%! The OECD global tax project is effectively controlled by Europe. The deck is stacked against America. This must change.

HAPPENING NOW: I am chairing the @WaysandMeansGOP Tax Subcommittee Hearing: “Biden’s Global Tax Surrender Harms Americans Workers and Our Economy.”

Any Pennsylvanians outside of the one-mile radius who are seeking private well water testing are urged to contact the Pennsylvania Dept. of Environmental Protection (D.E.P.) for assistance. The number for their Northwest Pa. office is 814-332-6945.

The E.P.A. tells us they will consider expanding testing outside of the one-mile radius should they see chemical levels in well water spike inside the one-mile radius. Right now, they tell us well water levels inside the one-mile radius are safe.

My team and I were briefed by the E.P.A. this afternoon about the #EastPalestine train derailment. We were told there are no plans to test private well water outside of the one-mile radius of the crash site at this time.

The one-mile radius around the East Palestine crash site means just 22 Pennsylvania households are currently eligible to receive assistance from Norfolk Southern. We are working to get help for more Pennsylvanians who are concerned about air & water quality. #ohiotrainderailment

The House is back to working for the people. In just one week, the @HouseGOP was able to pass legislation that:

✅Repealed $72B to hire IRS agents
✅Prohibited sale of strategic oil to China
✅Defended babies born alive during abortions
✅Establish a Committee to counter the CCP

The Strategic Petroleum Reserve belongs to America, not China. Today, @HouseGOP took a big step to prevent the Biden administration from selling our oil reserves to the CCP. Details⬇️

Today is #NationalHumanTraffickingAwarenessDay. There are more than 40 million victims of human trafficking globally. 1 in 4 victims are children. This issue is a major concern along our borders, as well. We all share one common goal: to combat and #endtrafficking.

As the House prepares to vote on a pair of pro-life measures today, I'm proud to re-introduce my signature pro-life legislation, the Heartbeat Protection Act. Thanks to the more than 60 @HouseGOP colleagues who have joined me so far. Details⬇️

As my late great Notre Dame coach Ara Parseghian said, "As long as there's unity, there's strength."

My team and I handed out these notes to my @HouseGOP colleagues today. We must all come together and unite behind our party's commitment to the American people.
At the end of the day, all 435 members of the House are being held up by 20 people. The American people elected us to govern, to serve them. Let's get to work.
